line.content: Network Mom ACL Analyzer analyzes Cisco® IOS®, IOS-XR®, NX-OS, and ASA IPv4 access-lists. As of July 2019, it has two main functions:
• It finds errors in ACL configurations, including dreaded “misconfigured do-not-care-bit” errors (which have caused multiple security incidents at multiple companies).
• It tests specific UDP or TCP sockets against large ACL files to determine if the ACL already permits the socket. This can prevent the addition of duplicate lines to ACLs.
The ACL analyzer successfully analyzed a 50,000-line ACL in under 20 seconds.
As of July 2019, other ACL analyzer features are in development including:
• Additional platform support (next on the list are IOS-XE® and Arista® EOS®).
If you manage ACLs on Cisco network devices, get the Network Mom ACL Analyzer from the MacOS App Store. For $10, you can’t afford not to buy! ;-)

Netrek was the Internet’s _first_ team game. Originally implemented in 1988, Netrek programmers pioneered network programming for Internet gaming. I recently reimplemented a Netrek client in Swift using SpriteKit. A binary is available in the MacOS App Store. Source code is available under the MIT license in my GitHub repository.
